alert.note: Alert for Grainger; Hancock; Hawkins (Tennessee) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 15 at 4:32PM CDT by NWS Knoxville
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northern Hawkins, Hancock, northeastern Grainger, southeastern Lee and southwestern Scott Counties through 615 PM EDT... At 532 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Sneedville, moving northeast at 30 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Rogersville, Sneedville, Jonesville, Bean Station, Surgoinsville, Church Hill, Evanston, Dryden, Treadway and Mooresburg. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
